lead_paragraph: With retail sales unchanged between June and July, the Federal Reserve likely won’t be raising interest rates anytime soon.

headline.main: Consumers Surprise Economists by Zipping Wallets in July

snippet: With retail sales unchanged between June and July, the Federal Reserve likely won’t be raising interest rates anytime soon....
abstract: Commerce Dept reports retail sales in July were flat, compared with revised 0.8 percent rise in June; unexpected report signals consumption slowdown that could affect stronger economic growth projections.
